leaflet.candidateName: Leila Kiersch, Leila Eleson, Miranda La Vey, Neil Lewis, Patricia McCarthy, & Ken Simkin

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Working for reliable public transport using public transport. Produced a clear document plotting a better way forward for buses and connections across west Wales.
Supporting community schools and advising councils and the Welsh Assembly why they need to rethink their small school closures.
Support a vibrant economy, keeping local shops open, and ensuring a fair price for Welsh producers. Care for wildlife; arguing it is best to vaccinate not exterminate badgers.

issues.economy: Support a vibrant economy, keeping local shops open, and ensuring a fair price for Welsh producers.
issues.education: Supporting community schools and advising councils and the Welsh Assembly why they need to rethink their small school closures.
issues.environment: Care for wildlife; arguing it is best to vaccinate not exterminate badgers.

endorsements.endorsement: Small schools are great. They are at the heart of the community. The local primary gives children a good education in a secure and homely environment.

quotes.text: Small schools are great. They are at the heart of the community. The local primary gives children a good education in a secure and homely environment.

images.caption: Wales Green Party logo and candidates with contact information.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is double-sided and contains images of candidates, their contact details, key policies, and endorsements from a community member.
